meanings.definition: To choke or constrict the neck of (someone) so as to cause death.
meanings.sent1: The villain was strangulating the hero with a rope.
meanings.sent2: The python was strangulating its prey before swallowing it whole.
meanings.sent3: The scarf seemed to be strangulating the man, but it was just wrapped too tightly.
meanings.sent4: The vines were strangulating the tree, slowly cutting off its access to sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The image of the boa constrictor strangulating its victim was both terrifying and fascinating.

meanings.sent1: She was strangulating the balloon to make it pop.
meanings.sent2: The tight bandage was strangulating the wound, cutting off circulation.
meanings.sent3: The overly tight lid on the jar seemed to be strangulating it, making it impossible to open.
meanings.sent4: The snake was strangulating the mouse in its coils, squeezing tighter with each breath.
meanings.sent5: The boa constrictor was strangulating the branch, causing it to snap under the pressure.

meanings.sent1: The high taxes were strangulating small businesses in the area.
meanings.sent2: The strict rules were strangulating the creativity of the students.
meanings.sent3: The bureaucracy seemed to be strangulating the progress of the project.
meanings.sent4: The debt was strangulating their financial freedom, leaving them with no room to breathe.
meanings.sent5: The lack of resources was strangulating the growth of the company, stifling its potential.
